chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: Hello, how are you? This is Lakshya.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: We are back with our DPMs lecture number 12.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: Today we are going to discuss a very important topic which is Transactions.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: What are transactions in a database?

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: What are the properties of transactions?

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: A very famous interview question is what are asset properties?

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: We will study this in this video.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: First of all, we will know what is a transaction?

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: To understand this, you have a banking system.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: Suppose I have two accounts in this bank.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: This is the second account. This is your personal bank.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: you have 1000 rupees in this bank.

chunks.text: And your friend has 2000 rupees in this bank.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: Now what you have to do is to transfer money from your bank to your friend's bank.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: How much you have to do?

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: You are paying 50 rupees on Google.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: So you are going to do a transaction of 50 rupees.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: Not transaction, we don't call it anything else.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: You are going to do a task.

chunks.text: You have to transfer 50 rupees from bank account A to account B.

chunks.text: Now if I say this from the perspective of the user,

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: But for DB system, this is not a single operation.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: This transaction will work in this way.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: I will call it as a transaction.

chunks.text: So, you see, I had done right A from here.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: All the changes you have undone.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: When transaction reaches the fail state,

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: All the changes made in the buffer are reversed.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: Whatever changes have been made in the buffer,

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: Whatever you have done in the system,

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: Whatever changes you have done in XYZ,

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: You will reverse all of them.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: Transaction reaches abort state after rollback.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: T.B. state prior to the T.A.A.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: When it is in the terminate state,

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: You come back to the stage 1.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: You can come back to the stage 1.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: Because, failure came in the middle.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: Transaction is set to be terminated

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: If either it is committed or aborted.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: Begin transition and end transition are two operators.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: Whatever work is happening in between,

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: All of it is partially committed.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: If there is any problem in between,

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: We do it directly on phase state.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: We roll back at some checkpoint or at some state.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: And when you come out of the end transition block,

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: You come to the terminate state.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: Either it is aborted and terminated.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: Or it is committed and terminated.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: So, this was the story of your transaction states.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: What is your life cycle of transaction?

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: So, this was something in this lecture.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: In this lecture, we have learned everything about transaction.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: But, now one more important question arises.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: We will do this in lecture 13.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: We will discuss this in next lecture.

chunks.title: ACID Properties && Transactions in DBMS
chunks.text: So, we will end this lecture here.
